background.header: Welcome to the MozFest 2018 Call for Proposals
body: MozFest sessions cover a wide range of topics, but share two important qualities: they are interactive and inclusive. Interactive as you want to be engaging and activating your participants from the beginning, and getting them making and doing, rather than listening and watching. Inclusive by welcoming all ages, all experience levels and disciplines to participate.

Anyone may submit a proposal for MozFest 2018. Once you have submitted your session, it will enter an open curation process on GitHub. All information you submit here, apart from email and Twitter handle will be seen publicly. We do encourage collaboration on Github, but it is not mandatory.
Sessions may have anywhere from 3 to 25 participants, with a vast range of abilities and ages. Everyone at the festival is welcome to attend any and all of the sessions during the event
Before you submit, please make use of the following tools

• (links to be added later )
  • know the spaces you will submit under
  • https://medium.com/mozilla-festival/what-makes-a-great-mozilla-festival-session-529dff105185
  • (insert Amira webinar)
Proposals are due August 1st. Once our dedicated team of Space Wranglers have had a chance to review each proposal we will contact individuals later in August.

Should you would like to submit your session in another language we have outlined ways for you to do so within this form. If you have difficulty submitting via a texted based form please reach out to us on the email below to discuss other accessibility options.
If you have any questions, please email festival@mozilla.org.
At MozFest, sessions are thematically organised into spaces. Please read the brief descriptions of each space here before answering the following questions.

l10n.header: MozFest will be hosted with English as the principle language and the majority of participants will speak English as first or second language.
body: However if you wish to lead your session in another language or support your session in multiple languages, please let us know. We know from previous years we have a substancial numbers of Spanish, German and French speakers in attendance.
We have created 3 session formats so that

1. we can understand what type of session you will deliver
  2. understand how you see the participants interacting with your sessio

form_field_labels.space: What space do feel your session will best contribute to?
form_field_labels.secondaryspace: Is there an alternate space your session could contribute to?
form_field_labels.l10nwish: Do you wish to propose or deliver your session in another language?
form_field_labels.l10nsupport: MozFest may not be able to support all languages but we will work with you to provide the best support we can. Will you need additional support from MozFest to deliver this session on the day?
form_field_labels.l10nlanguage: What language will you delivery your session in
form_field_labels.name: What is the name of your session?
form_field_labels.description: What will happen in your session?
form_field_labels.outcome: What is the goal or outcome of your session?
form_field_labels.afterfestival: After the festival, how will you and your participants take the learning and activities forward?
form_field_labels.timeneeded: How much time you will need?
form_field_labels.numsofparticipants: How will you deal with varying numbers of participants in your session? What if 30 participants attend? What if there are 3?
form_field_labels.format: Choose from the formats below that most suits your session delivery
form_field_labels.travelstipend_hint: MozFest has a limited number of travel stipends to help those who otherwise would not be able to attend. In the past, our stipends have been able to support a diverse group of people that are from global networks, who are students or youth. Or those who do not have the financial capacity to attend the event, through personal funds or work.
form_field_labels.travelstipend: Do you quantify yourself as such?
form_field_labels.needs_hint: Many attendees bring a personal device (smartphone, laptop or tablet) to the festival. We can provide you with a projector, and office supplies (paper, pens, post-it notes). Please note we may not be able to support all of your needs but will work with you to provide the best solution possible.
form_field_labels.needs: If your session requires additional materials or electronic equipment, please outline your needs.

l10nsupport.yes: Yes, to help translate the session on the day in English
l10nsupport.no: No, I can host the sessions myself

l10nlanguage.no: No, I have changed my mind

format.learning_forum: Learning Forum: Sessions under this format develop and implement ideas for improvement, exchange or review
format.gallery: Gallery: This format hosts interactive exhibits, installations, games, stalls- designed for 1:1 self driven experiences or small group activities. Often these experiences or activities are not scheduled time blocks but take place over the day or weekend allowing access and interaction at any time
format.shed: Shed: Sessions under this format require hands-on making, hacking and prototyping. These sessions will ask participants to create and build code, objects or crafts.

timeneeded.all_weekend: All weekend, as an installation, exhibit or drop-in session

form_validation_errors.empty_value: This field cannot be left blank.
form_validation_errors.max_word_reached: You have typed more words than allowed.
form_validation_errors.errors_above: Something isn't right. Please fix the errors indicated above.

form_system_messages.server_error: Sorry! We are unable to submit your proposal at the moment. Please try again or contact us.
form_system_messages.thank_you: Thank you for your session proposal.
